==Events==
*[[539 BC]] &ndash; The army of [[Cyrus the Great]] of [[Persia]] takes [[Babylon]].
* [[633]] &ndash; [[Battle of Hatfield Chase]]: King [[Edwin of Northumbria]] is defeated and killed by the British under [[Penda of Mercia]] and [[Cadwallon ap cadfan|Cadwallon of Gwynedd]]. 
*[[1113]] &ndash; The city of [[Oradea]] is first mentioned under the [[Latin]] name Varadinum ("vár" means fortress in [[Hungarian language|Hungarian]]).
*[[1216]] &ndash; [[John of England|King John]] of [[Kingdom of England|England]] loses his crown jewels in [[The Wash]], probably near [[Fosdyke]], perhaps near [[Sutton Bridge]].
*[[1279]] &ndash; [[Nichiren]], a Japanese Buddhist monk founder of [[Nichiren Buddhism]], inscribes the Dai-Gohonzon.
*[[1398]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Salynas]] is signed between [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania|Grand Duke of Lithuania]] [[Vytautas the Great]] and the [[Teutonic Knights]], who received [[Samogitia]].
*[[1492]] &ndash; [[Christopher Columbus]]'s expedition makes landfall in the [[Caribbean]], specifically in [[The Bahamas]]. The explorer believes he has reached the [[Indies]].
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]] this day does not exist in this year in [[Italy]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]] and [[Spain]].
*[[1654]] &ndash; The [[Delft Explosion#Delft Explosion|Delft Explosion]] devastates the city in the [[Netherlands]], killing more than 100 people.
*[[1692]] &ndash; The [[Salem witch trials]] are ended by a letter from Massachusetts Governor [[William Phips]].
*[[1748]] &ndash; British and Spanish naval forces engage at the [[Battle of Havana (1748)|Battle of Havana]] during the [[War of Jenkins' Ear]].
*[[1773]] &ndash; America's first [[insane asylum]] opens for 'Persons of Insane and Disordered Minds' in [[Virginia]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; First celebration of [[Columbus Day]] in the [[United States|USA]] held in [[New York City]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; The cornerstone of [[Old East]], the oldest state university building in the [[United States]], is laid on the campus of the [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill|University of North Carolina]].
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[Jeanne Geneviève Labrosse]] was  the first woman to jump from a balloon with a parachute, from an altitude of 900 meters.
*[[1810]] &ndash; First [[Oktoberfest]]: The [[Bavaria]]n royalty invites the citizens of [[Munich]] to join the celebration of the marriage of [[Ludwig I, King of Bavaria|Crown Prince Ludwig of Bavaria]] to Princess Therese von Sachsen-Hildburghausen.
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Peter I of Brazil]] is proclaimed the emperor of the [[Brazilian Empire|Brazil]].
*[[1823]] &ndash; [[Charles Macintosh]] of [[Scotland]] sells the first [[raincoat]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; [[Criminal Tribes Act]] (CTA) enacted by [[British rule in India]], which named over 160 local communities '[[Denotified Tribes|Criminal Tribes]]', i.e. hereditary criminals. [[Repeal]]ed in 1949, after [[Independence of India]].
*[[1892]] &ndash; The [[Pledge of Allegiance]] is first recited by students in many US [[Public school (government funded)|public schools]], as part of a celebration marking the 400th anniversary of Columbus's voyage.
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[President]] [[Theodore Roosevelt]] officially renames the "Executive Mansion" to the [[White House]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[United Kingdom|British]] nurse [[Edith Cavell]] is executed by a [[Germany|German]] firing squad for helping [[Allies of World War I|Allied]] soldiers escape from [[Belgium]]
*[[1917]] &ndash; World War I: The [[First Battle of Passchendaele]] takes place resulting in the largest single day loss of life in [[New Zealand]] history.
*[[1918]] &ndash; A [[1918 Cloquet Fire|massive forest fire]] kills 453 people in [[Minnesota]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; An [[Negative pressure ventilator|iron lung]] respirator is used for the first time at Children's Hospital, [[Boston]]
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[United States Army]] Disciplinary Barracks on [[Alcatraz Island]], is acquired by the [[United States Department of Justice]]
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]:  [[Japan]]ese ships retreat after their defeat in the [[Battle of Cape Esperance]] with the Japanese commander, [[Aritomo Gotō]] dying from wounds suffered in the battle and two Japanese [[destroyer]]s sunk by [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] air attack.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The Liberation of Athens from the German invaders.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Desmond Doss]] is the first [[conscientious objector]] to receive the U.S. [[Medal of Honor]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; "[[The Caine Mutiny Court Martial]]" opens at [[Plymouth Theatre]], [[New York City]]
*[[1959]] &ndash; At the national congress of [[Alianza Popular Revolucionaria Americana|APRA]] in [[Peru]] a group of leftist radicals are expelled from the party. They will later form [[APRA Rebelde]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[Nikita Khrushchev]] [[shoe-banging incident|pounds his shoe on a desk]] at [[United Nations]] General Assembly meeting to protest a [[Philippine]] assertion of [[Soviet Union]] colonial policy being conducted in [[Eastern Europe]]
*  1960   &ndash; Television viewers in Japan unexpectedly witness the assassination of [[Inejiro Asanuma]], leader of the [[Japan Socialist Party]], when he is stabbed and killed during a live broadcast.
*[[1962]] &ndash; Infamous [[Columbus Day Storm]] strikes the U.S. Pacific Northwest with record wind velocities; 46 dead and at least U.S. $230 million in damages
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] launches the [[Voskhod 1]] into Earth [[orbit]] as the first spacecraft with a multi-person crew and the first flight without [[space suit]]s
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: US Secretary of State [[Dean Rusk]] states during a news conference that proposals by the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] for peace initiatives are futile because of [[North Vietnam]]'s opposition
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Equatorial Guinea]] becomes independent from [[Spain]]
*[[1970]] &ndash; Vietnam War: US President [[Richard Nixon]] announces that the [[United States]] will withdraw 40,000 more troops before [[Christmas]]
*[[1979]] &ndash; The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, the first of five books in the ''[[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy|Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]]'' [[Comic science fiction|comedy science fiction]] series by [[Douglas Adams]] is published.
*  1979   &ndash; The lowest recorded non-tornadic atmospheric pressure, 87.0 kPa (870 mbar or 25.69 inHg), occurred in the Western Pacific during [[Typhoon Tip]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Japan]]'s former Prime Minister [[Tanaka Kakuei]] is found guilty of taking a [[Lockheed bribery scandals|$2 million bribe]] from [[Lockheed Corporation|Lockheed]] and is sentenced to 4 years in jail.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Brighton hotel bombing]]: The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] attempt to assassinate [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[Margaret Thatcher]] and her cabinet. Thatcher escapes but the bomb kills five people and wounds 31.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom]] and [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh]] visit the [[People's Republic of China]]
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Jaffna University Helidrop]]: Commandos of Indian Peace Keeping Force raided the Jaffna University campus to capture the [[LTTE]] chief and walked into a trap.
*  1988   &ndash; Two officers of the [[Victoria Police]] are gunned down executional style in the [[Walsh Street police shootings]], [[Australia]].
*  1988   &ndash; [[Birchandra Manu massacre]] in [[Tripura]], [[India]]
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Askar Akayev]], previously chosen [[President of Kyrgyzstan]] by republic's [[Supreme Soviet]], is confirmed president in an uncontested poll.
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[1992 Cairo earthquake|5.8 earthquake occurred]] in Cairo, Egypt. At least 510 died.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[NASA]] loses [[radio]] contact with the [[Magellan spacecraft]] as the probe descends into the thick atmosphere of [[Venus]] (the spacecraft presumably burned up in the atmosphere).
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Sidi Daoud massacre]] in [[Algeria]]; 43 killed at a fake roadblock.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Pervez Musharraf]] takes power in [[Pakistan]] from [[Nawaz Sharif]] through a bloodless [[1999 Pakistani coup d'état|coup]].
*  1999   &ndash; The former Autonomous Soviet Republic of [[Abkhazia]] declares its independence from [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]
*[[2000]] &ndash; The [[USS Cole (DDG 67)|USS ''Cole'']] is badly damaged in [[Aden, Yemen]], by two [[USS Cole bombing|suicide bombers]], killing 17 crew members and wounding at least 39.
*[[2002]] &ndash; Terrorists [[2002 Bali terrorist bombing|detonate bombs]] in the [[Sari Club]] in  [[Kuta]], [[Bali]], killing 202 and wounding over 300.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Michael Schumacher]] wins his 6th [[List of Formula One World Drivers' Champions|Formula One Drivers' championship]] at the [[2003 Japanese Grand Prix]] to beat the 48 year old record held by [[Juan Manuel Fangio]]
*[[2005]] &ndash; The second [[People's Republic of China|Chinese]] [[human spaceflight]] ''[[Shenzhou 6]]'' launched carrying [[Fèi Jùnlóng]] and [[Niè Hǎishèng]] for five days in orbit.
*[[2013]] &ndash; 51 people are killed after a truck [[2013 Peru bus disaster|veers off a cliff]] in [[La Convencion Province]] in [[Peru]].
